intro: Parapteroceras, commonly known as the horned sea hare, is a species of sea slug belonging to the family Anaspidae. It is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like protrusions on its mantle, which are believed to serve as a defense mechanism. The plant, though primarily marine, has a unique botanical structure with a soft, gelatinous body and a radula for feeding on algae. It lacks true leaves and flowers, instead relying on its ability to absorb nutrients from its environment. Parapteroceras plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to the ecological balance through its feeding habits.
